title: Strategies for Addressing Pedagogical Non-Compliance in Mathematics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental mathematics pedagogy and instructional design experience
context.additional_context: A process for analyzing and exploring response strategies to pedagogical noncompliance phenomena occurring in mathematics education settings, targeting pre-service and in-service teachers

learning_goals: Students can identify three or more instances of instructional non-compliance occurring in a mathematics microlearning environment.
Learners can explain two or more cognitive and environmental factors causing failure to perform expected learning activities.
Learners can design a three-step or more personalized instructional support strategy to minimize instructional non-compliance in mobile environments.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
